name: Robin Bledsoe Splash Plop
description: Perfect for little ones. Completely fenced in with puddles forming in center for sitting and wading. Water cannons that don't swing far enough to soak spectators.
additional_details: Bathrooms just outside fence. Ample parking. Pack sunscreen and brimmed hats.

name: The Quarry Splash City
description: Incredible splash city with astroturf. Train depot nearby runs on :15 and :45 of every hour.
additional_details: Cash only, honesty policy for payment. Very clean bathrooms. Large parking lot with backup lot. Early arrival recommended for shade.

name: Elizabeth Milburn Tot Time
address: 1901 Sun Chase Blvd, Cedar Park, TX
description: Shallow pool for ages 0-5 with waterslide and attentive lifeguards. Pool supplies lifejackets.
additional_details: Large canopies over seating areas. Not far from swimming area bathrooms. Plenty of parking.

name: Prete Plaza Main Street Splash Pad
address: 221 E Main St, Round Rock, TX
description: Located across from Round Rock public library which offers story time a couple times a week.
additional_details: Street-lined parking only, can get tricky. May need to walk a few blocks. Johnny on the Spots nearby, rumor of public restroom available.

name: Falcon Pointe Slippery Splash
description: Splash pad in residential neighborhood. Can be slick, splash with caution.
additional_details: Very close and clean bathrooms. Street parking only. Be courteous of residents and their mailboxes/driveways.

name: NE Metro Hidden Splash Gem
address: 15500 Sun Light Near Way, Pflugerville, TX
description: Hidden gem often with no other people around. Located near skate park in southern part of park.
additional_details: Large canopies cover playscape. Very clean bathrooms close to area. Easy parking. Hard to find - follow signs to skate park.

name: Bartholomew Soak Pad
description: Recently renovated playground and park with municipal pool nearby (costs a few bucks).
additional_details: Lots of shade. Brand new parking lot. Clean bathrooms since renovation.

name: Bailey Park Drench Pad
description: You will get SOAKED here! Dump buckets, waterfalls, ground poppers - Bailey has it all!
additional_details: Large trees surrounding area. Bathrooms often not the most delightful. Parking can be tricky with school and hospital nearby.

name: Chestnut Splash Pad
description: Fairly unknown splash pad with lots of open space for flying kites or frolicking.
additional_details: Large covered picnic area and tree-covered playground. Pad itself in sunshine. 1 portable toilet, quite clean. Street parking in residential area.

name: Pease Park Splash Pad
description: Multiple playgrounds and fields with stone picnic tables. Located along Shoal Creek Trail.
additional_details: Exceptionally well maintained bathrooms. Parking at bottom of hill is lucky - prepare for San Francisco-style parking brake use.

name: Rosewood Secret Splashery
description: Perfect mix of sun and shade. Hardly ever anyone else here with spot-on amount of water features.
additional_details: Two handicap port-a-potties close by or official toilets in community center up hill. Two parking lots available.

name: Eastwoods Spankin' New Splash
description: Huge park with tons of space to play. City worked hard to revive this beautiful park.
additional_details: Great trees throughout park. Must pay for parking and find spot not reserved for residents. Bathrooms across park in decent shape.

name: Metz Splash Pad
description: Located off Eastern tip of Ladybird Lake Hike and Bike Trail. FREE lunch on Fridays at community center.
additional_details: Bathrooms in community center - dry off before entering. Public restrooms down the hill. One large parking lot.

name: Clarksville Shady Splashing
description: Often has resident kids but never feels overcrowded. Beware of south bench - you will get wet!
additional_details: Bathrooms connected to splash area in decent shape. Street parking only, can get congested.

name: Liz Carpenter Splashapalooza
description: Popular central location splash pad. Many fun places to grab food nearby including The Picnic Food Truck Park.
additional_details: Not much shade. New and exceptionally clean bathrooms. Nearly impossible parking unless you pay fee at Parmer Events Center.

name: Ricky Guerrero Sopping Splashscape
description: In Southern heart of downtown and so FUN! Not a well kept secret, so be prepared for busy pad and to get drenched!
additional_details: Shade appreciated in August. Bathrooms right next to splashing but need TLC. Small parking lot fills quickly, street parking available.

name: Dick Nichols Splash Fountain
description: More of an oversized whale/dolphin fountain. Won't leave you wringing out clothes. 1.2 mile loop great for scooters or beginning bikers.
additional_details: Newly installed canopies and big Live Oaks provide shade. Bathrooms adjacent to playscape, well maintained. Plentiful parking.

name: Bee Cave Galleria Splash Dance
address: 12700 Hill Country Blvd, Bee Cave, TX
description: Right next to library. New jets added and moved location for more lawn space and seating.
additional_details: Wooden arbor taken down so pad in direct sunlight. Several sets of bathrooms nearby. Mall parking available.

name: Brushy Creek Splash Pad
address: 3300 Brushy Creek Rd, Cedar Park, TX
description: Once named by Austin Chronicle 'Best Place to Play in a Fountain.' Located at Brushy Creek Lake Park.
additional_details: Temporarily closed for renovations - set to open late summer 2024. Free and open daily through Labor Day.

name: El Salido Pool
hours: Open year round, water heated to 82 degrees
description: Anderson Mill's pool has a fun toddler pool with sprinklers. It also has three diving boards in its bigger pool.
additional_details: You don't need to be a resident of Anderson Mill to use the pool. Anderson Mill Pool is open in summer and has a slide and four lap lanes.

name: Scott Mentzer Pool
address: 901 Old Austin Hutto Rd, Pflugerville, TX
description: This pool has a small lazy river, a toddler slide, and water slides (kids must be 48 inches to use the slides on their own).
additional_details: Please take note that this pool is closed on Mondays.

name: Veterans Memorial Pool
address: 2525 W New Hope Dr, Cedar Park, TX
description: This is an 8,300 sq. ft. activity pool with a drop slide, jumping platform, and water playground. Additional amenities include a family slide, cargo net log crossing, water basketball, and rentable poolside shade.
additional_details: Veterans Memorial Pool is closed on Tuesdays.

name: Micki Krebsbach Pool
address: 301 Deep Wood Dr, Round Rock, TX
description: This pool has a pirate ship that is 26 feet long and 23 feet high water adventure for all ages! The ship includes wet and wild climbing angles, and water cannons for major family fun.
additional_details: It also has water slides and a water crossing obstacle (kids must be 48 inches to ride the large slide and use the water crossing).

name: Lakewood Splash Pad
address: 10870 E Crystal Falls Pkwy, Leander, TX 78641
hours: Open from the first weekend in April to the last weekend in October
description: Public splash pad in Leander area.

name: Mary Elizabeth Branch Park
description: Texas Farmers Market at Mueller location with fun splash pad. Caters more to older children or toddlers comfortable with big water jets.
additional_details: Come on Sunday to enjoy local vendors then cool off in water. Few trees for shade. Nice restaurants walking distance, playground nearby, Thinkery around corner.
